card.question:
The root element of an HTML document is:

  1. body
  2. head
  3. html
  4. All of the above
  5. None of the above
card.hint: The root element is the outer-most element.

card.question:
Which if the following elements are used to define a list?

  1. ol
  2. p
  3. pre
  4. All of the above
  5. None of the above
card.hint: There are two types of lists, ordered and unordered.

card.question: What is hypertext? How is hypertext included in an HTML document?
card.answer:
Hypertext is text that contains a mechanism for the user to move between (and within) a document.

It is included in HTML using the a element (which includes an href attribute that refers to the other location.

card.question: What is the purpose of a stylesheet?
card.answer: A stylesheet defines the form/appearance of a document.
card.hint: HTML is used to mark up the hierarchical parts of a document.

card.question: What does the word "Cascading" refer to in "Cascading Stylesheets".
card.answer: It refers to the way in which precedence is given to the different stylesheets that might be associated with a single document.

card.question: What are the two parts of a rule in CSS?
card.hint: Write down a rule, divide it into two parts, and describe the parts.

card.question:
Describe the following CSS rule: 

p {color: red; font-style: italic;}
card.answer: The text in p elements (i.e., paragraph elements) will be rendered in red and in italics.

card.question:
Describe the following CSS rule: 

body > p {font-family: sans-serif;}
card.answer: The text in all p elements that are immediately contained in the body element will be rendered in a sans serif font.
card.hint:
It is not the same as the following CSS rule: 

body  p {font-family: sans-serif;}

card.question:
Given the following stylesheet: 

    <style>
p         {color: red;}
p#final   {color: orange;}
section   {color: blue;}
section p {color: yellow;}

Write a document (in HTML) and associated stylesheet (in CSS) that will be rendered as follows when displayed in a browser.
card.answer:
body     {font-size:    10pt; padding:      10px;}
em:hover {background: yellow;}
header   {border-color: black; border-style: solid; border-width: 0px;
          border-bottom-width: 2px; font-size: 16pt; height: 50px;}
